commentaryTitle: Neque porro quisquam est qui dolorem ipsum quia dolor sit amet, consectetur, adipisci velit...

items.title: Emgality (galcanezumab) injection in pre-filled pen
items.shortSummary: SPC now advises that serious hypersensitivity reactions including cases of anaphylaxis, angioedema and urticaria have been reported. If a serious hypersensitivity reaction occurs, administration of galcanezumab should be discontinued immediately and appropriate therapy initiated

items.title: Opioid prescribing trends and geographical variation in England
items.comment: Study also found that the larger practice list size, ruralness, and deprivation were associated with greater high-dose prescribing rates. The CCG to which a practice belongs accounted for 11.7% of the variation in high-dose prescribing.
items.shortSummary: There were substantial increase in opioid (OP) prescribing in NHS between 1998 and 2016; OP prescriptions increased by 34% (from 568/1000 patients to 761/1000). After correcting for total oral morphine equivalency, increase was 127% (from 190,000 to 431,000mg/1000 population).

source.title: Journal of the American Medical Association

items.title: Effect of Vitamin C, Hydrocortisone, and Thiamine vs Hydrocortisone Alone on Time Alive and Free of Vasopressor Support Among Patients With Septic Shock
items.comment:
The median of all paired differences between the two arms was –0.6 hours (95% CI, –8.3 to 7.2 hours; p= 0.83). 

A related editorial states this RCT adds to the cumulative evidence from 13 different studies performed in 10 different countries; which all indicate that high-dose vitamin C with or without thiamine and steroids does not provide significant survival benefits for patients with sepsis or septic shock.
items.shortSummary: Exploratory RCT (n=216) found IV vitamin C, hydrocortisone & thiamine vs. IV hydrocortisone alone, does not significantly improve duration of time alive & free of vasopressor administration over 7 days (122.1 hrs vs. 124.6 hrs, respectively).
